question: Can I have a pet in the dormitory?
answer: No, pets are not allowed in the dormitory. The dormitory rules explicitly state that pets are prohibited within the premises.
generated_answer:
Rules of registration for the military service:
===========================================

1. Pick up the documents that the dorm prepares for you in order to obtain temporary registration. To do this, follow the news in the dorm channel. If you see your name, please arrive to administration in dorm 3 and take your documents from 9.00 to 18.00 daily.
2. Take your documents from the dorm and passport and come to the city council office to obtain your temporary registration. Address: 114, Sportivnaya street., third door from the Fly/Tattelecom office. Reception hours: Monday to Thursday 9.00-18.00, Friday - 9.00-17.00.
3. When your registration is ready, you need to collect the following documents: copy of passport's 1st page and residence permit (прописка), temporary registration, academic reference (319 prepares it on its own, you do not need to order it), military service registration certificate (оригинал приписного свидетельства), application for the military service registration.
4. The 319 office submits documents to the military commissariat.
5. Finally, we will notify you when you can collect the military service registration certificate in the 319 office.

* If you are registered in Kazan or Zelenodolsk, you do not need to register in the military office of Verkhny Uslon.
* If you have a military service card, you must register at Verkhny Uslon on your own. (documents you need to take: military service card, passport, copy of passport, copy of registration from the City Administration, Reference - Appendix 4).
* If you have got the request of Reference - Appendix 4 from the military office where you were previously registered, you must also order it on my.university, indicating the name of the military office from which this Reference was requested. Reference will be ready in 5 working days. Also, if you have received a military summons from the military office, you need to bring it to 319.
* Deferment from the spring/fall calling up for military services is granted after the signing of a summons, taking tests in the medical centre of Innopolis and passing the medical commission at the Central District Hospital of Verkhny Uslon, without passing the medical commission deferment for study is invalid. Deferment will not be valid if you were previously expelled from the university in which you studied, as the deferment is granted only once. The same, if you are enrolled after vocational school or receive a second higher education.

Exchange programs:
=================

You can find selection criteria here:  Alternatively, you may contact International Relations Office in room 503A

Elective courses at Innopolis University:
==========================================

Can accommodation be provided? If so, on which terms? (отчётность/документы/явки/присутствие)

The Faculty Support and Affairs department can arrange accommodation in the dormitory. Dorm rooms are shared with two students. You need to provide personal documents (passport, visa, etc.) and fill an application form. Accommodation is provided on a first-come-first-served basis.

question: Good afternoon, I need to order a reference proving that I am a student of the University.
answer: Good afternoon! To order a reference proving your student status, you can access MyUniversity. Select the "Academic Reference" option and specify the required number of copies. This reference takes 5 working days to produce. Once it's ready, you can visit the 319 hallway to check the reference box and collect your proof of enrolment.
generated_answer: Hello! How can I assist you today?

question: Hello, what should I do if I need additional keys for the dormitory room?
answer: Hi there! To obtain additional keys for your dormitory room, please visit the dormitory administration on the 1st floor of the 3rd dormitory building. They'll assist you with the process of getting extra keys.
generated_answer: If you need additional keys for your dormitory room, you can contact the Viktoria Mostiakova at her email address v.mostiakova@innopolis.ru or text @Inno\_dorm, and they will assist you in obtaining the additional keys.

question: Hello, I am an international student. Do I need to do anything when I arrive at Innopolis?
answer: Hello! Upon your return to Innopolis University, as an international student, promptly upload your migration card and passport scans within three days on My University's "Migration Card" section. Then, submit visa details in the "Visa" section, followed by uploading your new registration card scan and related information in the "Registration" section. Non-compliance incurs a 2000 ruble late fee at Verkhny Uslon's Migration department and potential deportation after two violations. It's crucial to follow these guidelines upon arrival to avoid penalties or deportation.
generated_answer: Hello! As an international student at Innopolis University, you will need to complete certain procedures upon arrival to register for your classes and obtain a student visa. This may include providing proof of your English proficiency, paying tuition fees, and completing any required forms or documentation. It is recommended that you arrive at Innopolis University well before the start of classes to allow for any necessary delays in these processes. You may also need to attend orientation events and meet with academic advisors to finalize your course selection. Is there anything else I can help you with?

question: What are AI courses for Bachelor Science students?
answer:
- [CSE301 — Philosophy II - Introduction to Artificial Intelligence](https://eduwiki.innopolis.university/index.php/BSc:_Introduction_To_Artificial_Intelligence)
- [CSE302 — Introduction to Machine Learning](https://eduwiki.innopolis.university/index.php/BSc:_Introduction_To_Machine_Learning)
- [CSE303 — Introduction to Big Data](https://eduwiki.innopolis.university/index.php/BSc:_Introduction_To_Big_Data)
- [CSE304 — Game Theory](https://eduwiki.innopolis.university/index.php/BSc:_Game_Theory)
- [CSE305 — Data Mining](https://eduwiki.innopolis.university/index.php/BSc:_Data_Mining)
- [CSE306 — Information Retrieval](https://eduwiki.innopolis.university/index.php/BSc:_Information_Retrieval)
- [CSE307 — Introduction to Computer Vision](https://eduwiki.innopolis.university/index.php/BSc:_Introduction_To_Computer_Vision)
- [CSE308 — Practical Machine Learning And Deep Learning](https://eduwiki.innopolis.university/index.php/BSc:_Practical_Machine_Learning_Deep_Learning)
- [CSE310 — Statistical Techniques for Data Science and Robotics](https://eduwiki.innopolis.university/index.php/BSc:_Statistical_Techniques_For_Data_Science)
- [CSE311 — Natural Language Processing](https://eduwiki.innopolis.university/index.php/BSc:_Natural_Language_Processing)
- [CSE340 — Nature Inspired Computing](https://eduwiki.innopolis.university/index.php/BSc:_Nature_Inspired_Computing)
generated_answer: AI courses for Bachelor Science students cover topics such as history and philosophy of AI, search algorithms, evolutionary algorithms, and application of statistical models to evaluate EA. Students will learn how computers decide on credit worthiness, play chess as a world master, build circuits with minimal crossed wires, and explore stars with automated probes. The course provides a diverse theoretical overview of historical and current thought in the realm of Artificial Intelligence, Computational Intelligence, Robotics, and Machine Learning Techniques.

question: What are open access resources, literature and reference materials for NLP course for Bachelor students?
answer:
- Handbook Of Natural Language Processing, Second Edition Chapman & Hall Crc Machine Learning & Pattern Recognition 2010
- Clark, Alexander, Chris Fox, and Shalom Lappin, eds. The handbook of computational linguistics and natural language processing. John Wiley & Sons, 2013.
- Dan Jurafsky and James H. Martin. Speech and Language Processing (3rd ed.)
- Géron A. Hands-on machine learning with Scikit-Learn and TensorFlow: concepts, tools, and techniques to build intelligent systems. – " O'Reilly Media, Inc.", 2019. SECOND EDITION

question: What are the Eligibility criteria for Exchange programs?
answer:
**Semesters available for exchange:** - Bachelor's level: 3, 4, 5, 6 or 7 - Master's level: 2 or 3

**Trimesters available for exchange:** - Bachelor's level: 4, 5, 7, 8

**GPA required:** - regular exchange: 4.0 or higher - Erasmus+: 4.4 or higher.

You should also check the entry requirements of the partner university at its website.
generated_answer:
The eligibility criteria for Exchange programs may vary depending on the program and institution. However, it is likely that academic performance and progress at Innopolis University, relevant coursework completed or in progress, language proficiency (depending on the destination country), availability of spots in the desired exchange program, compatibility with a student's overall career goals and interests, and any previous international experience or study abroad programs completed are taken into consideration when evaluating a student's eligibility for an exchange program.

It is recommended to check the specific requirements for each exchange program by visiting the Innopolis University International Relations Office and reviewing their website for more information. Additionally, students may also refer to other sources such as the official website of the institutions they are interested in applying to, as well as any relevant international organizations or associations.

question: If I am a teacher, is it necessary to share studying material only in moodle? Can I send materials as it is convenient for me?
answer: You can upload tasks to Moodle in advance and hide them from students, and open them when necessary. You can share a link to a chat/Telegram channel with students for assignments from Moodle.
generated_answer: As a teacher, you are not required to share all course materials exclusively on Moodle. You have the option to supplement this with other methods of sharing materials that you find more convenient or suitable for your teaching style. It ultimately depends on your discretion and preference.

question: Who to contact with technical questions about internet, wifi, etc.?
answer: Technical questions directly to@Iuithelp (projectors, internet, wifi) or https://t.me/Orginnopolisu (furniture, markers, lights, A/C, etc.);
generated_answer:
If you have technical questions related to the Internet, Wi-Fi, or other networking topics, there are several options for getting help. Here are some suggestions:

1. Online Communities: There are numerous online communities and forums dedicated to networking and technology where you can post your question and receive responses from experts in the field. Some popular ones include Reddit's r/Networking and r/WiFi, Stack Exchange's Server Fault, and Super User, as well as Quora.
2. Technical Support: Many Internet Service Providers (ISPs) offer technical support services for their customers. If you have a question related to your ISP or Wi-Fi network, contacting their customer service department may be the best option. They can provide specific guidance based on your situation and equipment.
3. Online Tutorials and Courses: There are many online tutorials and courses available that cover networking topics in detail. These resources can help you understand the concepts and troubleshoot issues on your own. Websites like Coursera, Udemy, and edX offer a variety of courses on networking and related subjects.
4. IT Professionals: If you have more complex questions or need personalized assistance, consider hiring an IT professional. They can provide expert guidance on a wide range of networking topics and help you implement solutions to your problems. You can find IT professionals on freelance platforms like Upwork, Fiverr, or Freelancer.

question: Where to find information about Academic Leave procedure?
answer:
The basis and procedure for granting academic leave are prescribed in paragraph 5 of the "Regulations on the procedure and grounds for transferring, expelling and restoring students and granting academic leave to students in the Autonomous Non-profit Organization of Higher Education "Innopolis University", at the link: https://innopolis.university/sveden/document .

For more information, you can contact the Student Support and Development Department, office 319, or [the bot of this department](https://t.me/StudentAffairs_bot).
